runs.comm: what a start for South Africa, wicket first ball, Denly shuffles across and tries to work the ball away fine on the leg side and the umpire's finger goes up...Langeveldt is over the moon and the local crowd are on their feet. Wow, nothing like a quiet start
full outside off, tempting the drive, scoots past the edge through to Prior...good start from Anderson. Some movement under the lights
punched out into the covers...valuable to get some early dot balls in
driven firmly straight down the pitch, Langeveldt gets a boot on it in his follow through
he loses his line this time, searching for that late swing, and it's a big wide down the leg side
lunges onto the front foot, gets a thick inside edge into the leg side and midwicket swoops to field
tight line on off stump, Trott defends firmly into the off side
back of a length, Trott stands tall and pushes into the covers to end an eventful opening over
good start on off stump, Cook watchfully pushes back down the pitch
opens his account with a back-cut down to third man...the outfield, as usual here, looks quick
nips back into Trott from back of a length, worked into the gap at midwicket and Trott is off the mark which will be a relief for him
way down the leg side, that's an easy call for the umpire...wides doing England a favour so far

edged, just out of reach of first slip, second slip has just come out and the ball races down to third man for four...that would have been a sitter for second slip and Cook has got away with one as he pushes unconvincingly outside off stump
defended into the leg side
flicked neatly off his pads, timed nicely but he picks out the man at midwicket
full on middle, Trott walks into the shot and flicks down to mid-on
the best shot so far...Trott advances this time, backs to the leg side and flays the ball through the covers...once it beats the field the ball races across the outfield. A confident shot from Trott
good response from Langeveldt, bangs it in outside off and it climbs sharply past Trott who drops his hands and watches it through to the keep
dragged down short, sits up this time and Trott pulls through midwicket but not with quite enough power to reach the boundary as Steyn chases well from mid-oon
full outside off, Cook leans into a rather rigid cover drive but, like Trott's previous shot, it doesn't have enough to reach the boundary as the South Africans chase it down hard
steered down to third man, in the air but well wide of backward point
more good intent from Trott, takes a step out of his crease and whips the ball off his pads down to fine leg...he doesn't appeared fazed by the occasion
swung away off his pads with as Cook moves to the off side but it's superbly fielded on the fine-leg boundary to keep England to a couple
whipped away again down to fine leg, McLaren's line just a little off
another one goes, and that was as plumb as you'll see...Cook misses a low full-toss on leg stump and that was crashing straight into the timber.
full outside off, driven firmly to point
worked off his pads through square leg to open his account
timed nicely, flicked into the leg side but straight at midwicket
oh, what clever thinking from Steyn, sends down an early slower-ball and Trott nearly spoons a catch to point as he drives early. However, the ball loops into the gap
that didn't look as though it would come near a boundary, but Trott had cut it so hard into the ground that it bounced over backward point and beat third man
top shot, a cracking cover drive from Trott as he shows the confidence to come forward to Steyn's pace...was a bit of  floaty ball from Steyn
South Africa's main striker is struggling a little, tries to bang this in and Trott responds with a strong pull...there are plenty of runs on offer out there
that makes it four in a row, great response from Trott and that's a tick in England's box as Trott takes 18 off Steyn's first over with another spanking drive through the covers
dabbed out to deep square leg, and the flying Trott is back on strike
a big stride forward and met with a full face of the bat
same again, another confident thrust down the wicket, and defended with aplomb. That's an aggressive defence
belted out of the park, lovely strike! Too short, swung lustily, over backward square and into the stands
great riposte, a yorker, dug out and squirted for a single
some dramatic fielding on the cover boundary cuts off a delicate but firm push. Good stuff from England
short and wide, and slow turn. Cut firmly backward of point
a bit of spin, but too short again. This time it is slashed up and over point, a touch inelegantly, but who's bothered?
fuller and flatter, and defended from the crease. That one skidded on a touch
a bona-fide nurdle into the leg-side, a step across the line and a dab to square leg
slapped into the covers, a tidy over so far

well, well, there's drama here. A sharp single to point, a sharper throw comes in. Roelof makes a hash of his attempt at taking off the bails but just does enough with his knuckle in the end, and that's gone
cautious defence to launch his innings
short, and just outside off stump. Collingwood sways out of line
dabbed to square leg. Another single, better judged this time
tucked off the hip and Morgan finds the gap at midwicket
outside off again. Coolly left alone
quick running makes two from one, as Collingwood slaps a cut down to third man
outside off, and cut to point
sharp spin, but slides down the leg side
crashed firmly into the deep. The cover sweeper tidies up
that's a cracking stroke. Botha came around the wicket, Morgan came down the track to meet the pitch of the ball, inside the line and up and over the covers.
good riposte, right on the mark and defended
worked into space on the leg side
big stride and defended back down the track
nudged off the hip for a single, as Roelof switches ends
Morgan's trademark reverse slap comes into play, but he can't beat the man at backward point and is left to scurry for the far end
a loud grunt of anguish gives away the hideousness of that delivery, as Collingwood seizes on a long-hop and spanks it over cow corner
faster and fuller, and defended with a hurry
more anguish for van der Merwe, as Colly picks the gap and that's four more through midwicket
big stride forward and defended
swished out to square leg as Botha cramped his premeditated charge
down the leg-side, and that's a wide
there's no cutting that one off. A genuine snicked edge, could almost count as a chance for the keeper, except Boucher didn't have time to blink
gets off strike
very nicely played, dug out from round the wicket, and timed as well, with a firm wristy push through backward point. Good work on the boundary cuts off the four
a short-arm jab over midwicket, collected on the bounce at the left-hander's cow corner. England are ticking along contentedly for now
fast and furious from the leaky Steyn, but a fraction too wide, and that allows Morgan to take a liberty outside off and flash an edge for four
better line this time, but he's still going at 12 an over
caught on the back foot by a tighter line and length, and Collingwood chops a chinese cut past his stumps and out to square leg

that is a sensational strike! Short again from Steyn but arrow straight, and Morgan met it with a ferocious swing of the bat, and the ball cleared the stands and bounced on the roof of the building opposite!
a misfield turns a tight two into an easy two, and South Africa have some worries
forward and defended out to cover. Another mauling in that over for Steyn
whipped out to midwicket
well bowled, held back in the flight, and Morgan had to wait. and waited well
flashed out to deep cover
it was there for the cut, and then it wasn't. So nearly an edge into the keeper's gloves, but he just eludes the edge
there he goes again, the reverse-slap, up and over the two men back for the shot. There's no stopping it when he gets it right
a single to keep the strike, and England are on course for a very challenging total
outside off, nips off the seam a touch, but not enough to be called a wide
too full, and Morgan makes him pay with a drilled four through the covers
Morkel over-compensates by dragging his length back, and that has gone miles once again! Into the stands at cow corner, and England are cooking
knee-high full-toss, and Morkel opts for neither one thing nor the other. The result is a clubbed four through long-on
better length, and played well. Morgan rode the bounce and dabbed a single to third man
in the slot for Collingwood this time, that is a horrible over for Morkel, as the ball sails over the right-hander's long-on. Momentary threat of a catch on the boundary, but that was travelling
working the singles now, there are plenty on offer
reverse sweep, up and over the infield and swept up by third man
down the track to meet the pitch, and clobbered once again, over midwicket. Both men are now on 49 ...
Collingwood wins the race, dabbed into the covers, an instant single, and that's a 27-ball half-century. And that is motoring in any language
outside off, a bit of bounce, and a rare false stroke
on the pads, tucked down the leg side, and that's Morgan's fifty, from 29 balls. Which hardly pales by comparison
Langeveldt returns, Morgan slashes into the covers, and another single
in the blockhole with an offcutter, nicely bowled, and nearly a run-out as Morgan has to dive for his crease
he's got it wrong this time. Just too short, and Collingwood bulldozes that over midwicket
full-toss, and Langeveldt was appealing for lbw. Hint of an inside-edge? Either way, he's not out
good ball, outswinging yorker to the left-hander. Morgan still digs it out for a single though
yorker length again, but well wide of the stumps. Worked to point, and that's a mostly tidy over

that's the end of a cracking innings. Made room for a full-length delivery, but picked out the man in the deep at long-off. Superb batting, and England are on course for 200-plus, as Luke Wright arrives to biff a few
low full-toss, worked down to mid-on
good ball to start, nothing to work with
right up in the blockhole, and Wright baseball-slugs a single
an attempted hurling scoop, but this time he muffs it. Still a single though
an attempted Dilscoop, but hit on the bonce. Ouch. That was a fine over, and timely too for South Africa
full to start things off, which is good. Worked in front of square with urgency
full toss, clubbed hard down to long-off, where a fumble gifts a second run
full again, and hit on the pads, quick calling ensures a single
another full toss, but Wright doesn't time that at all, and AB de Villiers sets himself well and completes an easy catch.
good again from Steyn. Targetting the pads with a yorker length
made room, but Steyn followed him all the way. Well bowled
thumped along the ground, out to deep long-off
width again, full length, Prior attempts to carve over point, but he didn't get the elevation and Albie Morkel swallowed the chance with a deft leap
another yorker, that is clearly the way to go on this track
overpitched and a touch too wide, Morgan moves his front leg out of the way, and frees his arms. A welcome four
made a charge, but McLaren over-compensated
woomph. That was wonderfully straight. A full swing with the front leg out of the way, and that is deposited over the ropes
misdirected, a tickle to help it on the way, and suddenly England - or rather Morgan - have rediscovered their impetus
sensible batting from Bresnan, a measured push to point to hand over the strike
a full toss outside leg, but funnily enough the ideal delivery. Morgan makes contact, but not a lot
thumped into the covers again. The 200 is England's target
that is an outrageous stroke. Contortions at the crease as Morgan drops to one knee, turns his stance inside out, and drives over fine leg for six!
a bog-standard clip over midwicket for six! Stunning
driven into the covers to complete an utterly extraordinary performance. What. An. Innings.
